comment.body: Your ZeroWiki is really looking good. Impressive work! :-)

That list is only a small portion of all users. You need to browse 2 lists in order to see all ZeroID users:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/data/users.json  (2,674 users)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/data/users_archive.json  (19,505 users)

Your database might have some problems. I suggest you do the following:

1. Copy your address book to a text file.

2. Shut down your Bitmessage client.

3. Move (do not delete) the following file to another folder:
/.config/PyBitmessage/messages.dat

4. Start your Bitmessage client.

5. Send a message to someone.

Please note that all messages you have sent/received and your address book are stored in the messages.dat database.

@ks: When you start your Bitmessage client it may take some time before it has processed all messages. I suggest you wait until it has finished before sending a message.

I'm running the latest version 0.6.1through Tor and it works like a charm.
Did Erkan explain why he stopped using ZeroNet?
